Welcome

MultiProject is a Trac plugin, that allows multiple project hosting in Trac environments. MultiProject features an administration project, which can be used to define site front page, manage local and ldap groups and users, and a convenient way of hosting multiple trac projects. For more information, check the project home page, https://projects.developer.nokia.com/multiproject

MultiProject is under constant development. The following features are present, work fine and can be seen in action at: Developer Nokia: Projects

Install and setup Usage and help Develop & contribute

Features

Disclaimer: many of the features comes from the Trac itself. MultiProject only extends them or slightly modifies to fit it's needs.

  • Create projects Create or fork projects without separate acceptance process, with just few clicks.
  • Project Wikis Trac wiki system with all it's power and complexity is available for projects to use.
  • Version control Host your project in either git, svn or mercurial. Link revision numbers into Wiki and Tickets. Browse the source code with source code browser.
  • Files and downloads Easily share files and folders between your project members. Mount the files directly to your local computer.
  • Roadmap Plan major releases and milestones and track their progress and goals. Define expected completion dates, or do completely open milestone.
  • Details tracking Track changes and actions done for the project via project timeline, rss feeds and by email notifications.
  • Roadmap Plan major releases and milestones and track their progress and goals. Define expected completion dates, or do completely open milestone.
  • Permission system Extended permission system. Manage project permissions through groups and individual permissions.

Who's using it

Plugin is an outcome from Nokia project - solution that powers currently several production environments.

Coming from Trac?

MultiProject is not a fork from Trac, but a plugin. Having that said, it currently requires a bit more effort than enabling the component. Here are few reasons why to see the trouble:

  • Project creation from web UI
  • User management from web UI
  • Prepackage collection of plugins to work together
